   20: %%% Purpose : Test interaction Erlang/Drivers (new features as of R3A)
   21: 
   22: %%% Checks that new features (as of R3) of the Erlang/Driver
   23: %%% implementation works as expected.
   24: %%%
   25: %%% Things that should be tested:
   26: %%% - outputv
   27: %%% - timeouts
   28: %%% - queueing
   29: 
   30: -module(driver_SUITE).
   31: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, 
   32:          end_per_suite/1, init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   33:          init_per_testcase/2,
   34:          end_per_testcase/2,
   35: 
   36:          a_test/1,
   37:          outputv_echo/1,
   38:          timer_measure/1,
   39:          timer_cancel/1,
   40:          timer_change/1,
   41:          timer_delay/1,
   42:          queue_echo/1,

   44:          driver_unloaded/1,
   45:          io_ready_exit/1,
   46:          use_fallback_pollset/0,
   47:          use_fallback_pollset/1,
   48:          bad_fd_in_pollset/1,
   49:          fd_change/1,
   50:          steal_control/1,
   51:          otp_6602/1,
   52:          driver_system_info_base_ver/1,
   53:          driver_system_info_prev_ver/1,
   54:          driver_system_info_current_ver/1,
   55:          driver_monitor/1,
   56: 
   57:          ioq_exit_ready_input/1,
   58:          ioq_exit_ready_output/1,
   59:          ioq_exit_timeout/1,
   60:          ioq_exit_ready_async/1,
   61:          ioq_exit_ready_input_async/1,
   62:          ioq_exit_ready_output_async/1,
   63:          ioq_exit_timeout_async/1,
   64:          zero_extended_marker_garb_drv/1,
   65:          invalid_extended_marker_drv/1,
   66:          larger_major_vsn_drv/1,
   67:          larger_minor_vsn_drv/1,
   68:          smaller_major_vsn_drv/1,
   69:          smaller_minor_vsn_drv/1,
   70:          peek_non_existing_queue/1,
   71:          otp_6879/1,
   72:          caller/1,
   73:          many_events/1,
   74:          missing_callbacks/1,
   75:          smp_select/1,
   76:          driver_select_use/1,
   77:          thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean/1,
   78:          otp_9302/1,
   79:          thr_free_drv/1,
   80:          async_blast/1,
   81:          thr_msg_blast/0,
   82:          thr_msg_blast/1,
   83:          consume_timeslice/1,
   84:          env/1,
   85:          poll_pipe/1,
   86:          lots_of_used_fds_on_boot/1,
   87:          z_test/1]).
   88: 
   89: -export([bin_prefix/2]).
   90: 
   91: -export([get_check_io_total/1]).   % for z_SUITE.erl
   92: 
   93: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   94: 
   95: 
   96: % First byte in communication with the timer driver
   97: -define(START_TIMER, 0).
   98: -define(CANCEL_TIMER, 1).
   99: -define(DELAY_START_TIMER, 2).
  100: -define(TIMER, 3).
  101: -define(CANCELLED, 4).
  102: 
  103: % First byte in communication with queue driver
  104: -define(PUSHQ, 0).
  105: -define(ENQ, 1).
  106: -define(PUSHQ_BIN, 2).
  107: -define(ENQ_BIN, 3).
  108: -define(PUSHQV, 4).
  109: -define(ENQV, 5).
  110: 
  111: -define(DEQ, 6).
  112: -define(BYTES_QUEUED, 7).
  113: -define(READ_HEAD, 8).
  114: 
  115: -define(RANDOM, random).
  116: 
  117: % Max data size that is queued in one instance
  118: -define(MAX_DATA_SIZE, 16384).
  119: 
  120: % This is the allowed delay when testing the driver timer functionality
  121: -define(delay, 400).
  122: 
  123: -define(heap_binary_size, 64).
  124: 
  125: suite() ->
  126:     [{ct_hooks,[cth_log_redirect,ts_install_cth]},
  127:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
  128: 
  129: all() -> %% Keep a_test first and z_test last...
  130:     [a_test, outputv_errors, outputv_echo, queue_echo,
  131:      {group, timer},
  132:      driver_unloaded, io_ready_exit, otp_6602,
  133:      {group, polling},
  134:      {group, poll_thread},
  135:      {group, poll_set},
  136:      driver_system_info_base_ver,
  137:      driver_system_info_prev_ver,
  138:      driver_system_info_current_ver, driver_monitor,
  139:      {group, ioq_exit}, zero_extended_marker_garb_drv,
  140:      invalid_extended_marker_drv, larger_major_vsn_drv,
  141:      larger_minor_vsn_drv, smaller_major_vsn_drv,
  142:      smaller_minor_vsn_drv, peek_non_existing_queue,
  143:      otp_6879, caller, many_events, missing_callbacks,
  144:      thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean,
  145:      otp_9302,
  146:      thr_free_drv,
  147:      async_blast,
  148:      thr_msg_blast,
  149:      consume_timeslice,
  150:      env,
  151:      poll_pipe,
  152:      z_test].
  153: 
  154: groups() -> 
  155:     [{timer, [],
  156:       [timer_measure, timer_cancel, timer_delay,
  157:        timer_change]},
  158:      {poll_thread, [], [{group, polling}]},
  159:      {poll_set, [], [{group, polling}]},
  160:      {polling, [],
  161:       [a_test, use_fallback_pollset,
  162:        bad_fd_in_pollset, fd_change,
  163:        steal_control, smp_select,
  164:        driver_select_use,
  165:        lots_of_used_fds_on_boot,
  166:        z_test]},
  167:      {ioq_exit, [],
  168:       [ioq_exit_ready_input, ioq_exit_ready_output,
  169:        ioq_exit_timeout, ioq_exit_ready_async,
  170:        ioq_exit_ready_input_async, ioq_exit_ready_output_async,
  171:        ioq_exit_timeout_async]}].
  172: 
  173: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  174:     logger:add_handler_filter(default,
  175:       checkio_filter,
  176:       {fun F(#{ msg := {string,Str}} = Log, _State) ->
  177:                case re:run(Str,"(fds in pollset)|(Bad value on output port)") of
  178:                    {match,_} ->
  179:                        stop;
  180:                    _ ->
  181:                        Log
  182:                end;
  183:            F(#{ msg := {Fmt,Args}} = Log, State) when not is_atom(Fmt) ->
  184:                F(Log#{ msg := {string,io_lib:format(Fmt,Args)}}, State);
  185:            F(Log, _State) ->
  186:                Log
  187:        end, undefined}),
  188:     Config.
  189: 
  190: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  191:     logger:remove_handler_filter(default, checkio_filter),
  192:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  193: 
  194:     case nodes(connected) of
  195:         [] -> ok;
  196:         Nodes ->
  197:             [net_kernel:disconnect(N) || N <- Nodes],
  198:             io:format("LEAKED connections: ~p\n", [Nodes])
  199:     end.
  200: 
  201: 
  202: init_per_group(poll_thread, Config) ->
  203:     [{node_args, ["+IOt", "2"]} | Config];
  204: init_per_group(poll_set, Config) ->
  205:     [{node_args, ["+IOt", "2", "+IOp", "2"]} | Config];
  206: init_per_group(polling, Config) ->
  207:     case proplists:get_value(node_args, Config) of
  208:         undefined ->
  209:             Config;
  210:         Args ->
  211:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  212:             unlink(Peer), %% otherwise it will immediately stop
  213:             setup_logger(Node),
  214:             [{node, {Peer, Node}} | Config]
  215:     end;
  216: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  217:     Config.
  218: 
  219: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  220:     case proplists:get_value(node, Config) of
  221:         undefined ->
  222:             Config;
  223:         {Peer, _Node} ->
  224:             ok = peer:stop(Peer),
  225:             {save_config, proplists:delete(node, Config)}
  226:     end.
  227: 
  228: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
  229:     CIOD = rpc(Config,
  230:                fun() ->
  231:                        case catch erts_debug:get_internal_state(available_internal_state) of
  232:                            true -> ok;
  233:                            _ -> erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true)
  234:                        end,
  235:                        erts_debug:get_internal_state(check_io_debug)
  236:                end),
  237:     0 = element(1, CIOD),
  238:     [{testcase, Case}|Config].
  239: 
  240: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  241:     %% Logs some info about the system
  242:     ct_os_cmd("epmd -names"),
  243:     ct_os_cmd("ps aux"),
  244:     try rpc(Config, fun() ->
  245:                             get_stable_check_io_info(),
  246:                             erts_debug:get_internal_state(check_io_debug)
  247:                     end) of
  248:         CIOD ->
  249:             0 = element(1, CIOD)
  250:     catch _E:_R:_ST ->
  251:             %% Restart the node
  252:             case proplists:get_value(node, Config) of
  253:                 undefined ->
  254:                     ok;
  255:                 {Peer, _Node} ->
  256:                     peer:stop(Peer),
  257:                     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(proplists:get_value(node_args, Config)),
  258:                     unlink(Peer2), %% otherwise it will immediately stop
  259:                     setup_logger(Node2),
  260:                     Config2 = [{node, {Peer2, Node2}} | proplists:delete(node, Config)],
  261:                     {save_config, Config2}
  262:             end
  263:     end,
  264:     ok.
  265: 
  266: ct_os_cmd(Cmd) ->
  267:     ct:log("~s: ~ts",[Cmd,os:cmd(Cmd)]).
  268: 
  269: %% Test sending bad types to port with an outputv-capable driver.
  270: outputv_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  271:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  272:     erl_ddll:start(),
  273:     ok = load_driver(Path, outputv_drv),
  274: 
  275:     outputv_bad_types(fun(T) ->
  276:                               outputv_errors_1(T),
  277:                               outputv_errors_1([1|T]),
  278:                               L = [1,2,3],
  279:                               outputv_errors_1([L,T]),
  280:                               outputv_errors_1([L|T])
  281:                       end),
  282:     outputv_errors_1(42),
  283: 
  284:     %% Test iolists that do not fit in the address space.
  285:     %% Unfortunately, it would be too slow to test in a 64-bit emulator.
  286:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  287:         4 -> outputv_huge_iolists();
  288:         _ -> ok
  289:     end.
  290: 
  291: outputv_bad_types(Test) ->
  292:     Types = [-1,256,atom,42.0,{a,b,c},make_ref(),fun() -> 42 end,
  293:              [1|2],<<1:1>>,<<1:9>>,<<1:15>>],
  294:     _ = [Test(Type) || Type <- Types],
  295:     ok.
  296: 
  297: outputv_huge_iolists() ->
  298:     FourGigs = 1 bsl 32,
  299:     Sizes = [FourGigs+N || N <- lists:seq(0, 64)] ++
  300:     [1 bsl N || N <- lists:seq(33, 37)],
  301:     Base = <<0:(1 bsl 20)/unit:8>>,
  302:     [begin
  303:          L = build_iolist(Sz, Base),
  304:          outputv_errors_1(L)
  305:      end || Sz <- Sizes],
  306:     ok.
  307: 
  308: outputv_errors_1(Term) ->
  309:     Port = open_port({spawn_driver,outputv_drv}, []),
  310:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch port_command(Port, Term)),
  311:     port_close(Port).
  312: 
  313: build_iolist(N, Base) when N < 16 ->
  314:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  315:         1 ->
  316:             <<Bin:N/binary,_/binary>> = Base,
  317:             Bin;
  318:         _ ->
  319:             lists:seq(1, N)
  320:     end;
  321: build_iolist(N, Base) when N =< byte_size(Base) ->
  322:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  323:         1 ->
  324:             <<Bin:N/binary,_/binary>> = Base,
  325:             Bin;
  326:         2 ->
  327:             <<Bin:N/binary,_/binary>> = Base,
  328:             [Bin];
  329:         3 ->
  330:             case N rem 2 of
  331:                 0 ->
  332:                     L = build_iolist(N div 2, Base),
  333:                     [L,L];
  334:                 1 ->
  335:                     L = build_iolist(N div 2, Base),
  336:                     [L,L,45]
  337:             end
  338:     end;
  339: build_iolist(N0, Base) ->
  340:     Small = rand:uniform(15),
  341:     Seq = lists:seq(1, Small),
  342:     N = N0 - Small,
  343:     case N rem 2 of
  344:         0 ->
  345:             L = build_iolist(N div 2, Base),
  346:             [L,L|Seq];
  347:         1 ->
  348:             L = build_iolist(N div 2, Base),
  349:             [47,L,L|Seq]
  350:     end.
  351: 
  352: %% Test echoing data with a driver that supports outputv.
  353: outputv_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  354:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 10}),
  355:     Name = 'outputv_drv',
  356:     P = start_driver(Config, Name, true),
  357: 
  358:     ov_test(P, {bin,0}),
  359:     ov_test(P, {bin,1}),
  360:     ov_test(P, {bin,2}),
  361:     ov_test(P, {bin,3}),
  362:     ov_test(P, {bin,4}),
  363:     ov_test(P, {bin,5}),
  364:     ov_test(P, {bin,6}),
  365:     ov_test(P, {bin,7}),
  366:     ov_test(P, {bin,8}),
  367:     ov_test(P, {bin,15}),
  368:     ov_test(P, {bin,16}),
  369:     ov_test(P, {bin,17}),
  370: 
  371:     ov_test(P, {list,0}),
  372:     ov_test(P, {list,1}),
  373:     ov_test(P, {list,2}),
  374:     ov_test(P, [int,int,{list,0},int]),
  375:     ov_test(P, [int,int,{list,1},int]),
  376:     ov_test(P, [int,int,{list,2}]),
  377:     ov_test(P, [{list,3},int,int,{list,2}]),
  378:     ov_test(P, {list,33}),
  379: 
  380:     ov_test(P, [{bin,0}]),
  381:     ov_test(P, [{bin,1}]),
  382:     ov_test(P, [{bin,2}]),
  383:     ov_test(P, [{bin,3}]),
  384:     ov_test(P, [{bin,4}]),
  385:     ov_test(P, [{bin,5}]),
  386:     ov_test(P, [{bin,6},int]),
  387:     ov_test(P, [int,{bin,3}]),
  388:     ov_test(P, [int|{bin,4}]),
  389:     ov_test(P, [{bin,17},int,{bin,13}|{bin,3}]),
  390: 
  391:     ov_test(P, [int,{bin,17},int,{bin,?heap_binary_size+1}|{bin,3}]),
  392: 
  393:     stop_driver(P, Name),
  394:     ok.
  395: 
  396: ov_test(Port, Template) ->
  397:     Self = self(),
  398:     spawn_opt(erlang, apply, [fun () -> ov_test(Self, Port, Template) end,[]],
  399:               [link,{fullsweep_after,0}]),
  400:     receive
  401:         done -> ok
  402:     end.
  403: 
  404: ov_test(Parent, Port, Template) ->
  405:     true = port_connect(Port, self()),
  406: 
  407:     HeapData = build_data(Template),
  408:     io:format("Mostly heap binaries"),
  409:     ov_send_and_test(Port, HeapData, HeapData),
  410: 
  411:     %% Try sub binaries.
  412:     io:format("Mostly sub binaries of heap binaries"),
  413:     SubHeapData = make_sub_binaries(HeapData),
  414:     ov_send_and_test(Port, SubHeapData, HeapData),
  415: 
  416:     %% Try refc binaries.
  417:     io:format("Refc binaries"),
  418:     RefcData = make_refc_binaries(HeapData),
  419:     ov_send_and_test(Port, RefcData, RefcData),
  420: 
  421:     %% Try sub binaries of heap binaries.
  422:     io:format("Sub binaries of refc binaries"),
  423:     SubRefcData = make_sub_binaries(RefcData),
  424:     ov_send_and_test(Port, SubRefcData, RefcData),
  425:     io:format("", []),
  426: 
  427:     %% Garbage collect and make sure that there are no binaries left.
  428:     %% R7 note:
  429:     %%  - dead variables on the stack are killed after last use,
  430:     %%  - erlang:garbage_collect/0 collects garbage immediately.
  431:     %%  (there used to be dummy functions here)
  432:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  433:     {binary,[]} = process_info(self(), binary),
  434: 
  435:     %% Reassign Port back to parent and tell him we are done.
  436:     true = port_connect(Port, Parent),
  437:     Parent ! done.
  438: 
  439: ov_send_and_test(Port, Data, ExpectedResult) ->
  440:     io:format("~p ! ~P", [Port,Data,12]),
  441:     Port ! {self(),{command,Data}},
  442:     receive 
  443:         {Port,{data,ReturnData}} ->
  444:             io:format("~p returned ~P", [Port,ReturnData,12]),
  445:             compare(ReturnData, ExpectedResult);
  446:         {Port,{data,OtherData}} ->
  447:             ct:fail("~p returned WRONG data ~p", [Port,OtherData]);
  448:         Wrong ->
  449:             ct:fail({unexpected_port_or_data,Wrong})
  450:     end.
  451: 
  452: compare(Got, Expected) ->
  453:     case {list_to_binary([Got]),list_to_binary([Expected])} of
  454:         {B,B} -> ok;
  455:         {_Gb,_Eb} ->
  456:             ct:fail(got_bad_data)
  457:     end.
  458: 
  459: 
  460: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  461: %% 		Driver timer test suites
  462: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  463: 
  464: 
  465: %% Check that timers time out in good time.
  466: timer_measure(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  467:     Name = 'timer_drv',
  468:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
  469: 
  470:     try_timeouts(Port, 8997),
  471: 
  472:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
  473:     ok.
  474: 
  475: try_timeouts(_, 0) -> ok;
  476: try_timeouts(Port, Timeout) ->
  477:     TimeBefore = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  478:     erlang:port_command(Port, <<?START_TIMER,Timeout:32>>),
  479:     receive
  480:         {Port,{data,[?TIMER]}} ->
  481:             Elapsed = erl_millisecs() - erl_millisecs(TimeBefore),
  482:             io:format("Elapsed: ~p Timeout: ~p\n", [Elapsed, Timeout]),
  483:             if
  484:                 Elapsed < Timeout ->
  485:                     ct:fail(too_short);
  486:                 Elapsed > Timeout + ?delay ->
  487:                     ct:fail(too_long);
  488:                 true ->
  489:                     try_timeouts(Port, Timeout div 2)
  490:             end
  491:     after Timeout + 100*?delay ->
  492:               ct:fail("driver failed to timeout")
  493:     end.
  494: 
  495: %% Try cancelling timers set in a driver.
  496: timer_cancel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  497:     Name = 'timer_drv',
  498:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
  499: 
  500:     try_cancel(Port, 10000),
  501: 
  502:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
  503:     ok.
  504: 
  505: try_cancel(Port, Timeout) ->
  506:     T_before = erl_millisecs(),
  507:     Port ! {self(),{command,<<?START_TIMER,(Timeout + ?delay):32>>}},
  508:     receive
  509:         {Port, {data, [?TIMER]}} ->
  510:             ct:fail("driver timed out before cancelling it")
  511:     after Timeout -> 
  512:               Port ! {self(), {command, [?CANCEL_TIMER]}},
  513:               receive 
  514:                   {Port, {data, [?TIMER]}} ->
  515:                       ct:fail("driver timed out after cancelling it");
  516:                   {Port, {data, [?CANCELLED]}} ->
  517:                       Time_milli_secs = erl_millisecs() - T_before,
  518: 
  519:                       io:format("Time_milli_secs: ~p Timeout: ~p\n",
  520:                                 [Time_milli_secs, Timeout]), 
  521:                       if
  522:                           Time_milli_secs > (Timeout + ?delay) ->
  523:                               ct:fail("too long real time");
  524:                           Timeout == 0 -> ok;
  525:                           true -> try_cancel(Port, Timeout div 2)
  526:                       end
  527:               after 100*?delay ->
  528:                         ct:fail("No message from driver")
  529:               end
  530:     end.
  531: 
  532: %% Test that timers don't time out too early if we do a sleep
  533: %% before setting a timer.
  534: 
  535: timer_delay(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  536:     Name = 'timer_drv',
  537:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
  538: 
  539:     TimeBefore = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  540:     Timeout0 = 350,
  541:     erlang:port_command(Port, <<?DELAY_START_TIMER,Timeout0:32>>),
  542:     Timeout = Timeout0 + 1000,
  543:     receive
  544:         {Port,{data,[?TIMER]}} ->
  545:             Elapsed = erl_millisecs() - erl_millisecs(TimeBefore),
  546:             io:format("Elapsed time: ~p Timeout: ~p\n",
  547:                       [Elapsed,Timeout]), 
  548:             if
  549:                 Elapsed < Timeout ->
  550:                     ct:fail(too_short);
  551:                 Elapsed > Timeout + ?delay ->
  552:                     ct:fail(too_long);
  553:                 true ->
  554:                     ok
  555:             end
  556:     end,
  557: 
  558:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
  559:     ok.
  560: 
  561: %% Test that driver_set_timer with new timeout really changes
  562: %% the timer (ticket OTP-5942), it didn't work before
  563: 
  564: timer_change(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  565:     Name = 'timer_drv',
  566:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
  567: 
  568:     try_change_timer(Port, 10000),
  569: 
  570:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
  571:     ok.
  572: 
  573: try_change_timer(_Port, 0) -> ok;
  574: try_change_timer(Port, Timeout) ->
  575:     Timeout_3 = Timeout*3,
  576:     TimeBefore = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  577:     erlang:port_command(Port, <<?START_TIMER,Timeout_3:32>>),
  578:     erlang:port_command(Port, <<?START_TIMER,Timeout:32>>),
  579:     receive
  580:         {Port,{data,[?TIMER]}} ->
  581:             Elapsed = erl_millisecs() - erl_millisecs(TimeBefore),
  582:             io:format("Elapsed: ~p Timeout: ~p\n", [Elapsed,Timeout]),
  583:             if
  584:                 Elapsed < Timeout ->
  585:                     ct:fail(too_short);
  586:                 Elapsed > Timeout + ?delay ->
  587:                     ct:fail(too_long);
  588:                 true ->
  589:                     try_timeouts(Port, Timeout div 2)
  590:             end
  591:     after Timeout + 100*?delay ->
  592:               ct:fail("driver failed to timeout")
  593:     end.
  594: 
  595: 
  596: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  597: %% 		Queue test suites
  598: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  599: 
  600: %% 1) Queue up data in a driver that uses the full driver_queue API to do this.
  601: %% 2) Get the data back, a random amount at a time.
  602: queue_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  603:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 10}),
  604:     Name = 'queue_drv',
  605:     P = start_driver(Config, Name, true),
  606: 
  607:     q_echo(P, [{?ENQ, {list,1}},
  608:                {?ENQ, {list,0}},
  609:                {?ENQ, {bin,0}},
  610:                {?ENQ, {bin,1}},
  611:                {?ENQ, {bin,2}},
  612:                {?ENQ, {bin,3}},
  613:                {?ENQ, {bin,4}},
  614:                {?ENQ, {bin,5}},
  615:                {?ENQ, {bin,600}},
  616:                {?PUSHQ, {list,0}},
  617:                {?PUSHQ, {list,1}},
  618:                {?PUSHQ, {bin,0}},
  619:                {?PUSHQ, {bin,1}},
  620:                {?PUSHQ, {bin,888}},
  621:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,0}},
  622:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,1}},
  623:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,2}},
  624:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,3}},
  625:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,4}},
  626:                {?ENQ_BIN, {bin,777}},
  627:                {?PUSHQ_BIN, {bin,0}},
  628:                {?PUSHQ_BIN, {bin,1}},
  629:                {?PUSHQ_BIN, {bin,334}},
  630:                {?ENQV, [{bin,0},{list,1},{bin,1},{bin,555}]},
  631:                {?ENQV, [{bin,0},{list,1},{bin,1}]},
  632:                {?PUSHQV, [{bin,0},{list,1},{bin,1},{bin,319}]}]),
  633: 
  634:     stop_driver(P, Name),
  635:     ok.
  636: 
  637: q_echo(Port, SpecList) ->
  638:     io:format("Heap binaries"),
  639:     HeapData = [{M,build_data(T)} || {M,T} <- SpecList],
  640:     {HeapDataReturn,HeapDataLen} = feed_driver(Port, HeapData),
  641:     dequeue(Port, HeapDataReturn, HeapDataLen, 1),
  642: 
  643:     %% Try sub binaries.
  644:     io:format("Sub binaries of heap binaries"),
  645:     SubHeapData = make_sub_binaries(HeapData),
  646:     %% The following line will generate a warning.
  647:     {HeapDataReturn,HeapDataLen} = feed_driver(Port, SubHeapData),
  648:     dequeue(Port, HeapDataReturn, HeapDataLen, 1),
  649: 
  650:     %% Try refc binaries.
  651:     io:format("Refc binaries"),
  652:     RefcData = make_refc_binaries(HeapData),
  653:     {RefcDataReturn,RefcDataLen} = feed_driver(Port, RefcData),
  654:     dequeue(Port, RefcDataReturn, RefcDataLen, 1),
  655: 
  656:     %% Try sub binaries of refc binaries.
  657:     io:format("Sub binaries of refc binaries"),
  658:     SubRefcData = make_sub_binaries(RefcData),
  659:     {RefcDataReturn,RefcDataLen} = feed_driver(Port, SubRefcData),
  660:     dequeue(Port, RefcDataReturn, RefcDataLen, 1),
  661: 
  662:     %% Try a writable binary.
  663:     io:format("Writable binaries"),
  664:     WritableBinData = make_writable_binaries(HeapData),
  665:     {WritableDataReturn,WritableDatalen} = feed_driver(Port, WritableBinData),
  666:     _ = append_to_writable_binaries(WritableBinData),
  667:     dequeue(Port, WritableDataReturn, WritableDatalen, 1),
  668: 
  669:     %% Try dequeing more than one byte at the time.
  670:     io:format("Heap binaries -- dequeueing more than one byte at the time"),
  671:     feed_and_dequeue(Port, HeapData, 2),
  672:     feed_and_dequeue(Port, HeapData, 3),
  673:     feed_and_dequeue(Port, HeapData, 4),
  674: 
  675:     io:format("\n").
  676: 
  677: feed_and_dequeue(Port, Data, DeqSize) ->
  678:     {DataReturn,DataLen} = feed_driver(Port, Data),
  679:     dequeue(Port, DataReturn, DataLen, DeqSize),
  680:     ok.
  681: 
  682: %% Send all data according to the specification to the driver side (where it
  683: %% is queued up for later return to this process).    
  684: 
  685: feed_driver(Port, Description) ->
  686:     feed_driver(Port, Description, <<>>, 0).
  687: 
  688: feed_driver(Port, [], ExpectedInPort, Qb) ->
  689:     io:format("Expected in port: ~P", [ExpectedInPort,12]),
  690:     io:format("In port: ~P", [read_head(Port, Qb),12]),
  691:     {ExpectedInPort,Qb};
  692: feed_driver(Port, [{Method0,Data}|T], Expected_return, Qb_before) ->
  693:     Method = case Method0 of
  694:                  ?RANDOM -> uniform(6)-1;
  695:                  Other -> Other
  696:              end,
  697:     Size = size(list_to_binary([Data])),
  698: 
  699:     %% ***********************************************************************
  700:     %% NOTE! Never never never change this to io:format/2, as that will imply
  701:     %% message sending, and sending as message will spoil the test of
  702:     %% writable binaries.
  703: 
  704:     %% erlang:display({sending,method_name(Method),Data}),
  705:     %% ***********************************************************************
  706: 
  707:     queue_op(Port, Method, Data),
  708: 
  709:     Qb_in_driver = bytes_queued(Port),
  710:     case Qb_before + Size of
  711:         Qb_in_driver -> ok;
  712:         Sum ->
  713:             ct:fail("Qb_before: ~p\n"
  714:                     "Qb_before+Size: ~p\n"
  715:                     "Qb_in_driver: ~p",
  716:                     [Qb_before,Sum,Qb_in_driver])
  717:     end,
  718:     X_return = case Method of
  719:                    ?ENQ -> list_to_binary([Expected_return,Data]);
  720:                    ?PUSHQ -> list_to_binary([Data,Expected_return]);
  721:                    ?PUSHQ_BIN -> list_to_binary([Data,Expected_return]);
  722:                    ?ENQ_BIN -> list_to_binary([Expected_return,Data]);
  723:                    ?PUSHQV -> list_to_binary([Data,Expected_return]);
  724:                    ?ENQV -> list_to_binary([Expected_return,Data])
  725:                end,
  726:     feed_driver(Port, T, X_return, Qb_before + Size).
  727: 
  728: %% method_name(0) -> pushq;
  729: %% method_name(1) -> enq;
  730: %% method_name(2) -> pushq_bin;
  731: %% method_name(3) -> enq_bin;
  732: %% method_name(4) -> pushqv;
  733: %% method_name(5) -> enqv.
  734: 
  735: dequeue(Port, DataList, LenToGet, DeqSize) ->
  736:     io:format("Dequeuing ~p bytes, ~p byte(s) at once...", [LenToGet,DeqSize]),
  737:     compare_return(Port, DataList, LenToGet, DeqSize).
  738: 
  739: compare_return(Port, _Data_list, 0, _Back_len) ->
  740:     0 = bytes_queued(Port);
  741: compare_return(Port, QueuedInPort0, Len_to_get, DeqSize) ->
  742:     case bytes_queued(Port) of
  743:         Len_to_get -> ok;
  744:         BytesInQueue ->
  745:             ct:fail("Len_to_get: ~p\nBytes in queue: ~p", [Len_to_get,BytesInQueue])
  746:     end,
  747:     BytesToDequeue = if (DeqSize > Len_to_get) -> Len_to_get;
  748:                         true -> DeqSize
  749:                      end,
  750:     Dequeued = read_head(Port, BytesToDequeue),
  751:     case bin_prefix(Dequeued, QueuedInPort0) of
  752:         true ->
  753:             deq(Port, BytesToDequeue),
  754:             <<_:BytesToDequeue/binary,QueuedInPort/binary>> = QueuedInPort0,
  755:             compare_return(Port, QueuedInPort, Len_to_get - BytesToDequeue, DeqSize);
  756:         false ->
  757:             ct:fail("Bytes to dequeue: ~p\nDequeued: ~p\nQueued in port: ~P",
  758:                     [BytesToDequeue, Dequeued, QueuedInPort0,12])
  759:     end.
  760: 
  761: %% bin_prefix(PrefixBinary, Binary)
  762: %%  Is PrefixBinary a prefix of Binary?
  763: 
  764: bin_prefix(<<C:8,PreTail/binary>>, <<C:8,Tail/binary>>) ->
  765:     bin_prefix(PreTail, Tail);
  766: bin_prefix(<<>>, _Bin) -> true;
  767: bin_prefix(_, _) -> false.
  768: 
  769: queue_op(Port, Method, Data) ->
  770:     [] = erlang:port_control(Port, Method, []),
  771:     Port ! {self(),{command,Data}},
  772:     ok.
  773: 
  774: bytes_queued(Port) ->
  775:     case erlang:port_control(Port, ?BYTES_QUEUED, []) of
  776:         <<I:32>> -> I;
  777:         Bad -> ct:fail({bad_result,Bad})
  778:     end.
  779: 
  780: deq(Port, Size) ->
  781:     [] = erlang:port_control(Port, ?DEQ, <<Size:32>>).
  782: 
  783: read_head(Port, Size) ->
  784:     erlang:port_control(Port, ?READ_HEAD, <<Size:32>>).
  785: 
  786: 
  787: driver_unloaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  788:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  789:     Drv = timer_drv,
  790:     User = self(),
  791:     Loaded = make_ref(),
  792:     Die = make_ref(),
  793:     Loader = spawn(fun () ->
  794:                            erl_ddll:start(),
  795:                            ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir,
  796:                                                                 Config),
  797:                                             Drv),
  798:                            User ! Loaded,
  799:                            receive Die -> exit(bye) end
  800:                    end),
  801:     receive Loaded -> ok end,
  802:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
  803:     Loader ! Die,
  804:     receive
  805:         {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
  806:             driver_unloaded = Reason
  807:             %% Reason used to be -1
  808:     end.
  809: 
  810: 
  811: io_ready_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  812:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  813:     Test = self(),
  814:     Dgawd = spawn(fun () ->
  815:                           ok = dgawd_handler:install(),
  816:                           Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Test),
  817:                           Test ! dgawd_handler_started,
  818:                           receive
  819:                               {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} -> ok;
  820:                               stop_dgawd_handler -> ok
  821:                           end,
  822:                           dgawd_handler:restore(),
  823:                           Test ! dgawd_handler_stopped
  824:                   end),
  825:     receive dgawd_handler_started -> ok end,
  826:     Drv = io_ready_exit_drv,
  827:     erl_ddll:start(),
  828:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), Drv),
  829:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
  830:     case erlang:port_control(Port, 0, "") of
  831:         "ok" ->
  832:             receive
  833:                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
  834:                     case Reason of
  835:                         ready_output_driver_failure ->
  836:                             io:format("Exited in output_ready()~n"),
  837:                             ok;
  838:                         ready_input_driver_failure ->
  839:                             io:format("Exited in input_ready()~n"),
  840:                             ok;
  841:                         Error -> ct:fail(Error)
  842:                     end
  843:             end,
  844:             receive after 2000 -> ok end,
  845:             false = dgawd_handler:got_dgawd_report(),
  846:             Dgawd ! stop_dgawd_handler,
  847:             receive dgawd_handler_stopped -> ok end,
  848:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
  849:             ok;
  850:         "nyiftos" ->
  851:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
  852:             {skipped, "Not yet implemented for this OS"};
  853:         Error ->
  854:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
  855:             ct:fail({unexpected_control_result, Error})
  856:     end.
  857: 
  858: 
  859: -define(CHKIO_STOP, 0).
  860: -define(CHKIO_USE_FALLBACK_POLLSET, 1).
  861: -define(CHKIO_BAD_FD_IN_POLLSET, 2).
  862: -define(CHKIO_FD_CHANGE, 4).
  863: -define(CHKIO_STEAL, 5).
  864: -define(CHKIO_STEAL_AUX, 6).
  865: -define(CHKIO_SMP_SELECT, 7).
  866: -define(CHKIO_DRV_USE, 8).
  867: 
  868: use_fallback_pollset() ->
  869:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
  870: 
  871: use_fallback_pollset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  872:     rpc(Config, fun() -> use_fallback_pollset_t(Config) end).
  873: 
  874: use_fallback_pollset_t(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  875:     FlbkFun = fun () ->
  876:                       {Flbk, _} = get_fallback(erlang:system_info(check_io)),
  877:                       case lists:keysearch(total_poll_set_size, 1, Flbk) of
  878:                           {value, {total_poll_set_size, N}} when N > 0 ->
  879:                               ok;
  880:                           Error ->
  881:                               ct:fail({failed_to_use_fallback, Error})
  882:                       end
  883:               end,
  884:     {BckupTest, Handel, OkRes}
  885:     = case chkio_test_init(Config) of
  886:           {erts_poll_info, ChkIo} = Hndl ->
  887:               case lists:keysearch(fallback, 1, ChkIo) of
  888:                   {value, {fallback, B}} when B =/= false ->
  889:                       {FlbkFun, Hndl, ok};
  890:                   _ ->
  891:                       {fun () -> ok end,
  892:                        Hndl,
  893:                        {comment,
  894:                         "This implementation does not use "
  895:                         "a fallback pollset"}}
  896:               end;
  897:           Skip ->
  898:               {fun () -> ok end, Skip, ok}
  899:       end,
  900:     io:format("Node = ~p~n",[node()]),
  901:     case chkio_test_fini(chkio_test(Handel,
  902:                                     ?CHKIO_USE_FALLBACK_POLLSET,
  903:                                     fun () ->
  904:                                             sleep(1000),
  905:                                             BckupTest()
  906:                                     end)) of
  907:         {skipped, _} = Res -> Res;
  908:         _ -> OkRes
  909:     end.
  910: 
  911: bad_fd_in_pollset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  912:     rpc(Config,
  913:         fun() ->
  914:                 chkio_test_fini(chkio_test(chkio_test_init(Config),
  915:                                            ?CHKIO_BAD_FD_IN_POLLSET,
  916:                                            fun () -> sleep(1000) end))
  917:         end).
  918: 
  919: fd_change(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  920:     rpc(Config,
  921:         fun() ->
  922:                 chkio_test_fini(chkio_test(chkio_test_init(Config),
  923:                                            ?CHKIO_FD_CHANGE,
  924:                                            fun () -> sleep(1000) end))
  925:         end).
  926: 
  927: steal_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  928:     rpc(Config,
  929:         fun() ->
  930:                 chkio_test_fini(case chkio_test_init(Config) of
  931:                                     {erts_poll_info, _} = Hndl ->
  932:                                         steal_control_test(Hndl);
  933:                                     Skip ->
  934:                                         Skip
  935:                                 end)
  936:         end).
  937: 
  938: steal_control_test(Hndl = {erts_poll_info, Before}) ->
  939:     Port = open_chkio_port(),
  940:     case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_STEAL_AUX, "") of
  941:         [$f,$d,$s,$:| _] = FdList ->
  942:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
  943:             sleep(500),
  944:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
  945:             Res = chkio_test(Hndl,
  946:                              ?CHKIO_STEAL,
  947:                              FdList,
  948:                              fun () ->
  949:                                      chk_chkio_port(Port),
  950:                                      sleep(500),
  951:                                      chk_chkio_port(Port)
  952:                              end),
  953:             case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_STOP, "") of
  954:                 "ok" ->
  955:                     chk_chkio_port(Port),
  956:                     ok;
  957:                 StopErr ->
  958:                     chk_chkio_port(Port),
  959:                     ct:fail({stop_error, StopErr})
  960:             end,
  961:             close_chkio_port(Port),
  962:             Res;
  963:         [$s,$k,$i,$p,$:,$\ |Skip] ->
  964:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
  965:             close_chkio_port(Port),
  966:             {chkio_test_result,
  967:              {skipped, Skip},
  968:              Before};
  969:         StartErr ->
  970:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
  971:             ct:fail({start_error, StartErr})
  972:     end.
  973: 
  974: chkio_test_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  975:     ChkIo = get_stable_check_io_info(),
  976:     case catch lists:keysearch(name, 1, ChkIo) of
  977:         {value, {name, erts_poll}} ->
  978:             ct:log("Before test: ~p~n", [ChkIo]),
  979:             Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  980:             erl_ddll:start(),
  981:             ok = load_driver(Path, 'chkio_drv'),
  982:             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  983:             {erts_poll_info, ChkIo};
  984:         _ ->
  985:             {skipped, "Test written to test erts_poll() which isn't used"}
  986:     end.
  987: 
  988: 
  989: chkio_test_fini({skipped, _} = Res) ->
  990:     Res;
  991: chkio_test_fini({chkio_test_result, Res, Before}) ->
  992:     ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver('chkio_drv'),
  993:     ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
  994:     After = get_stable_check_io_info(),
  995:     io:format("After test: ~p~n", [After]),
  996:     verify_chkio_state(Before, After),
  997:     Res.
  998: 
  999: open_chkio_port() ->
 1000:     open_port({spawn, 'chkio_drv'}, []).
 1001: 
 1002: close_chkio_port(Port) when is_port(Port) ->
 1003:     true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 1004:     receive
 1005:         {'EXIT', Port, normal} ->
 1006:             ok;
 1007:         {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 1008:             ct:fail({abnormal_port_exit, Port, Reason});
 1009:         {Port, Message} ->
 1010:             ct:fail({strange_message_from_port, Message})
 1011:     end.
 1012: 
 1013: chk_chkio_port(Port) ->
 1014:     receive
 1015:         {'EXIT', Port, Reason} when Reason /= normal ->
 1016:             ct:fail({port_exited, Port, Reason})
 1017:     after 0 ->
 1018:               ok
 1019:     end.
 1020: 
 1021: 
 1022: chkio_test({skipped, _} = Res, _Test, _Fun) ->
 1023:     Res;
 1024: chkio_test({erts_poll_info, _Before} = EPI, Test, Fun) when is_integer(Test) ->
 1025:     chkio_test(EPI, Test, "", Fun).
 1026: 
 1027: chkio_test({skipped, _} = Res, _Test, _TestArgs, _Fun) ->
 1028:     Res;
 1029: chkio_test({erts_poll_info, Before},
 1030:            Test,
 1031:            TestArgs,
 1032:            Fun) when is_integer(Test),
 1033:                      is_list(TestArgs) ->
 1034:     Port = open_chkio_port(),
 1035:     case erlang:port_control(Port, Test, TestArgs) of
 1036:         "ok" ->
 1037:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1038:             Fun(),
 1039:             During = get_check_io_total(erlang:system_info(check_io)),
 1040: 
 1041:             [0 = element(1, erts_debug:get_internal_state(check_io_debug)) ||
 1042:                 %% The pollset is not stable when running the fallback testcase
 1043:                 Test /= ?CHKIO_USE_FALLBACK_POLLSET],
 1044:             ct:log("During test: ~p~n", [During]),
 1045:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1046:             case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_STOP, "") of
 1047:                 Res when is_list(Res) ->
 1048:                     chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1049:                     io:format("~s", [Res]),
 1050:                     close_chkio_port(Port),
 1051:                     Res,
 1052:                     case Res of
 1053:                         [$c,$o,$m,$m,$e,$n,$t,$:,$\ |Cmnt] ->
 1054:                             {chkio_test_result,
 1055:                              {comment, Cmnt},
 1056:                              Before};
 1057:                         _ ->
 1058:                             {chkio_test_result,
 1059:                              Res,
 1060:                              Before}
 1061:                     end;
 1062:                 StopErr ->
 1063:                     chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1064:                     ct:fail({stop_error, StopErr})
 1065:             end;
 1066:         [$s,$k,$i,$p,$:,$\ |Skip] ->
 1067:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1068:             close_chkio_port(Port),
 1069:             {chkio_test_result,
 1070:              {skipped, Skip},
 1071:              Before};
 1072:         StartErr ->
 1073:             chk_chkio_port(Port),
 1074:             ct:fail({start_error, StartErr})
 1075:     end.
 1076: 
 1077: verify_chkio_state(Before, After) ->
 1078:     TotSetSize = lists:keysearch(total_poll_set_size, 1, Before),
 1079:     TotSetSize = lists:keysearch(total_poll_set_size, 1, After),
 1080:     case lists:keysearch(fallback, 1, Before) of
 1081:         {value,{fallback,false}} ->
 1082:             ok;
 1083:         _ ->
 1084:             BckupSetSize = lists:keysearch(fallback_poll_set_size,
 1085:                                            1,
 1086:                                            Before),
 1087:             BckupSetSize = lists:keysearch(fallback_poll_set_size,
 1088:                                            1,
 1089:                                                        After)
 1090:     end,
 1091:     ok.
 1092: 
 1093: get_stable_check_io_info() ->
 1094:     get_stable_check_io_info(10).
 1095: get_stable_check_io_info(0) ->
 1096:     get_check_io_total(erlang:system_info(check_io));
 1097: get_stable_check_io_info(N) ->
 1098:     ChkIo = get_check_io_total(erlang:system_info(check_io)),
 1099:     PendUpdNo = proplists:get_value(pending_updates, ChkIo, 0),
 1100:     ActFds = proplists:get_value(active_fds, ChkIo),
 1101:     case {PendUpdNo, ActFds} of
 1102:         {0, 0} ->
 1103:             ChkIo;
 1104:         _ ->
 1105:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1106:             get_stable_check_io_info(N-1)
 1107:     end.
 1108: 
 1109: %% Merge return from erlang:system_info(check_io)
 1110: %% as if it was one big pollset.
 1111: get_check_io_total(ChkIo) ->
 1112:     ct:log("ChkIo = ~p (~p)~n",[ChkIo, nodes()]),
 1113:     {Fallback, Rest} = get_fallback(ChkIo),
 1114:     OnlyPollThreads = [PS || PS <- Rest, not is_scheduler_pollset(PS)],
 1115:     add_fallback_infos(Fallback,
 1116:       lists:foldl(
 1117:         fun(Pollset, Acc) ->
 1118:                 lists:zipwith(fun(A, B) ->
 1119:                                       add_pollset_infos(A,B)
 1120:                               end,
 1121:                               Pollset, Acc)
 1122:         end,
 1123:         hd(OnlyPollThreads), tl(OnlyPollThreads))).
 1124: 
 1125: is_scheduler_pollset(Pollset) ->
 1126:     proplists:get_value(poll_threads, Pollset) == 0.
 1127: 
 1128: add_pollset_infos({Tag, A}=TA , {Tag, B}=TB) ->
 1129:     case tag_type(Tag) of
 1130:         sum ->
 1131:             {Tag, A + B};
 1132:         const ->
 1133:             case A of
 1134:                 B -> TA;
 1135:                 _ ->
 1136:                     ct:fail("Unexpected diff in pollsets ~p != ~p",
 1137:                             [TA,TB])
 1138:             end
 1139:     end.
 1140: 
 1141: get_fallback([MaybeFallback | ChkIo] = AllChkIo) ->
 1142:     case proplists:get_value(fallback, MaybeFallback) of
 1143:         true ->
 1144:             {MaybeFallback, ChkIo};
 1145:         false ->
 1146:             {undefined, AllChkIo}
 1147:     end.
 1148: 
 1149: add_fallback_infos(undefined, Acc) ->
 1150:     Acc;
 1151: add_fallback_infos(Flbk, Acc) ->
 1152:     lists:zipwith(fun({Tag, A}=TA, {Tag, B}=TB) ->
 1153:                           case tag_type(Tag) of
 1154:                               sum -> {Tag, A + B};
 1155:                               const when Tag =:= fallback -> TA;
 1156:                               const -> TB
 1157:                           end
 1158:                   end,
 1159:                   Flbk, Acc).
 1160: 
 1161: tag_type(name) -> const;
 1162: tag_type(primary) -> const;
 1163: tag_type(fallback) -> const;
 1164: tag_type(kernel_poll) -> const;
 1165: tag_type(memory_size) -> sum;
 1166: tag_type(total_poll_set_size) -> sum;
 1167: tag_type(lazy_updates) -> const;
 1168: tag_type(pending_updates) -> sum;
 1169: tag_type(batch_updates) -> const;
 1170: tag_type(concurrent_updates) -> const;
 1171: tag_type(max_fds) -> const;
 1172: tag_type(active_fds) -> sum;
 1173: tag_type(poll_threads) -> sum.
 1174: 
 1175: 
 1176: %% Missed port lock when stealing control of fd from a
 1177: %% driver that didn't use the same lock. The lock checker
 1178: %% used to trigger on this and dump core.
 1179: otp_6602(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1180:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1181:     Done = make_ref(),
 1182:     Parent = self(),
 1183:     Tester = spawn_link(Node,
 1184:                         fun () ->
 1185:                                 %% Inet driver use port locking...
 1186:                                 {ok, S} = gen_udp:open(0),
 1187:                                 {ok, Fd} = inet:getfd(S),
 1188:                                 %% Steal fd (lock checker used to
 1189:                                 %% trigger here).
 1190:                                 {ok, _S2} = gen_udp:open(0,[{fd,Fd}]),
 1191:                                 Parent ! Done
 1192:                         end),
 1193:     receive Done -> ok end,
 1194:     unlink(Tester),
 1195:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1196:     ok.
 1197: 
 1198: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES1,
 1199:         ["drv_drv_vsn",
 1200:          "emu_drv_vsn",
 1201:          "erts_vsn",
 1202:          "otp_vsn",
 1203:          "thread",
 1204:          "smp"]).
 1205: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES2,
 1206:         (?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES1 ++
 1207:          ["async_thrs",
 1208:           "sched_thrs"])).
 1209: 
 1210: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES3,
 1211:         (?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES2 ++
 1212:          ["emu_nif_vsn"])).
 1213: 
 1214: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES4,
 1215:         (?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES3 ++
 1216:          ["dirty_sched"])).
 1217: 
 1218: -define(EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES, ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES4).
 1219: 
 1220: 'driver_system_info_base_ver'(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1221:  driver_system_info_test(Config, sys_info_base_drv).
 1222: 
 1223: 'driver_system_info_prev_ver'(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1224:  driver_system_info_test(Config, sys_info_prev_drv).
 1225: 
 1226: driver_system_info_current_ver(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1227:     driver_system_info_test(Config, sys_info_curr_drv).
 1228: 
 1229: driver_system_info_test(Config, Name) ->
 1230:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
 1231:     case erlang:port_control(Port, 0, []) of
 1232:         [$o,$k,$:,_ | Result] ->
 1233:             check_driver_system_info_result(Result);
 1234:         [$e,$r,$r,$o,$r,$:,_ | Error] ->
 1235:             ct:fail(Error);
 1236:         Unexpected ->
 1237:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, Unexpected})
 1238:     end,
 1239:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
 1240:     ok.
 1241: 
 1242: check_driver_system_info_result(Result) ->
 1243:     io:format("All names: ~p~n", [?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES]),
 1244:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Result]),
 1245:     {[], Ns, DDVSN} = chk_sis(lists:map(fun (Str) ->
 1246:                                                 string:lexemes(Str, "=")
 1247:                                         end,
 1248:                                         string:lexemes(Result, " ")),
 1249:                               ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES),
 1250:     case {DDVSN,
 1251:           drv_vsn_str2tup(erlang:system_info(driver_version))} of
 1252:         {DDVSN, DDVSN} ->
 1253:             [] = Ns;
 1254:         %% {{1, 0}, _} ->
 1255:         %% 	  ExpNs = lists:sort(?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES
 1256:         %% 				   -- ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES1),
 1257:         %% 	  ExpNs = lists:sort(Ns);
 1258:         %% {{1, 1}, _} ->
 1259:         %% 	  ExpNs = lists:sort(?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES
 1260:         %% 				   -- ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES2),
 1261:         %% 	  ExpNs = lists:sort(Ns);
 1262:         {{3, 0}, _} ->
 1263:             ExpNs = lists:sort(?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES
 1264:                                -- ?EXPECTED_SYSTEM_INFO_NAMES3),
 1265:             ExpNs = lists:sort(Ns)
 1266:     end.
 1267: 
 1268: chk_sis(SIs, Ns) ->
 1269:     chk_sis(SIs, Ns, unknown).
 1270: 
 1271: chk_sis(SIs, [], DDVSN) ->
 1272:     {SIs, [], DDVSN};
 1273: chk_sis([], Ns, DDVSN) ->
 1274:     {[], Ns, DDVSN};
 1275: chk_sis([[N, _] = SI| SIs], Ns, DDVSN) ->
 1276:     true = lists:member(N, Ns),
 1277:     case check_si_res(SI) of
 1278:         {driver_version, NewDDVSN} ->
 1279:             chk_sis(SIs, lists:delete(N, Ns), NewDDVSN);
 1280:         _ ->
 1281:             chk_sis(SIs, lists:delete(N, Ns), DDVSN)
 1282:     end.
 1283: 
 1284: %% Data in first version of driver_system_info() (driver version 1.0)
 1285: check_si_res(["drv_drv_vsn", Value]) ->
 1286:     DDVSN = drv_vsn_str2tup(Value),
 1287:     {Major, DMinor} = DDVSN,
 1288:     {Major, EMinor} = drv_vsn_str2tup(erlang:system_info(driver_version)),
 1289:     true = DMinor =< EMinor,
 1290:     {driver_version, DDVSN};
 1291: check_si_res(["emu_drv_vsn", Value]) ->
 1292:     Value = erlang:system_info(driver_version);
 1293: check_si_res(["erts_vsn", Value]) ->
 1294:     Value = erlang:system_info(version);
 1295: check_si_res(["otp_vsn", Value]) ->
 1296:     Value = erlang:system_info(otp_release);
 1297: check_si_res(["thread", "true"]) ->
 1298:     true = erlang:system_info(threads);
 1299: check_si_res(["thread", "false"]) ->
 1300:     false = erlang:system_info(threads);
 1301: check_si_res(["smp", "true"]) ->
 1302:     true = erlang:system_info(smp_support);
 1303: 
 1304: %% Data added in second version of driver_system_info() (driver version 1.1)
 1305: check_si_res(["async_thrs", Value]) ->
 1306:     Value = integer_to_list(erlang:system_info(thread_pool_size));
 1307: check_si_res(["sched_thrs", Value]) ->
 1308:     Value = integer_to_list(erlang:system_info(schedulers));
 1309: 
 1310: %% Data added in 3rd version of driver_system_info() (driver version 1.5)
 1311: check_si_res(["emu_nif_vsn", Value]) ->
 1312:     Value = erlang:system_info(nif_version);
 1313: 
 1314: %% Data added in 4th version of driver_system_info() (driver version 3.1)
 1315: check_si_res(["dirty_sched", _Value]) ->
 1316:     true;
 1317: 
 1318: check_si_res(Unexpected) ->
 1319:     ct:fail({unexpected_result, Unexpected}).
 1320: 
 1321: -define(MON_OP_I_AM_IPID,1).
 1322: -define(MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,2).
 1323: -define(MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,3).
 1324: -define(MON_OP_MONITOR_ME_LATER,4).
 1325: -define(MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,5).
 1326: 
 1327: %% Test monitoring of processes from drivers
 1328: driver_monitor(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1329:     Name = monitor_drv,
 1330:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
 1331:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_I_AM_IPID,[]),
 1332:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]),
 1333:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1334:     {monitors, []} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1335: 
 1336:     "ok:"++Id1 = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME_LATER,[]),
 1337:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1338:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,Id1),
 1339:     {monitored_by, [Port]} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1340:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1341:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1342: 
 1343:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]),
 1344:     Me = self(),
 1345:     {Pid1,Ref1} =
 1346:     spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1347:                           Me ! port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]), 
 1348:                           Me ! process_info(self(),monitored_by), 
 1349:                           Me ! erlang:port_info(Port,monitors) 
 1350:                   end),
 1351:     ok = receive
 1352:              "ok" ->
 1353:                  ok
 1354:          after 1000 ->
 1355:                    timeout
 1356:          end,
 1357:     ok = receive
 1358:              {monitored_by, L} ->
 1359:                  L2 = lists:sort(L),
 1360:                  L3 = lists:sort([Me,Port]),
 1361:                  case L2 of
 1362:                      L3 ->
 1363:                          ok;
 1364:                      _ ->
 1365:                          mismatch
 1366:                  end
 1367:          after 1000 ->
 1368:                    timeout
 1369:          end,
 1370:     ok = receive
 1371:              {monitors, LL} ->
 1372:                  LL2 = lists:sort(LL),
 1373:                  LL3 = lists:sort([{process,Me},{process,Pid1}]),
 1374:                  case LL2 of
 1375:                      LL3 ->
 1376:                          ok;
 1377:                      _ ->
 1378:                          mismatch
 1379:                  end
 1380:          after 1000 ->
 1381:                    timeout
 1382:          end,
 1383:     ok = receive
 1384:              {'DOWN', Ref1, process, Pid1, _} ->
 1385:                  ok
 1386:          after 1000 ->
 1387:                    timeout
 1388:          end,
 1389:     ok = receive
 1390:              {monitor_fired,Port,Pid1} ->
 1391:                  ok
 1392:          after 1000 ->
 1393:                    timeout
 1394:          end,
 1395:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1396:     {monitors,[]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1397:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1398: 
 1399:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]),
 1400:     {Pid2,Ref2} =
 1401:     spawn_monitor(fun() -> 			       
 1402:                           receive go -> ok end,
 1403:                           Me ! port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME_LATER,[]), 
 1404:                           Me ! process_info(self(),monitored_by), 
 1405:                           Me ! erlang:port_info(Port,monitors) 
 1406:                   end),
 1407:     Pid2 ! go,
 1408:     {ok,Id2} = receive
 1409:                    "ok:"++II ->
 1410:                        {ok,II}
 1411:                after 1000 ->
 1412:                          timeout
 1413:                end,
 1414:     ok = receive
 1415:              {monitored_by, [Me]} ->
 1416:                  ok
 1417:          after 1000 ->
 1418:                    timeout
 1419:          end,
 1420:     ok = receive
 1421:              {monitors, [{process,Me}]} ->
 1422:                  ok
 1423:          after 1000 ->
 1424:                    timeout
 1425:          end,
 1426:     ok = receive
 1427:              {'DOWN', Ref2, process, Pid2, _} ->
 1428:                  ok
 1429:          after 1000 ->
 1430:                    timeout
 1431:          end,
 1432:     "noproc" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,Id2),
 1433:     {monitors,[{process,Me}]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1434:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1435:     "not_monitored" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1436:     {monitors,[]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1437:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1438: 
 1439: 
 1440:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME,[]),
 1441:     {Pid3,Ref3} =
 1442:     spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1443:                           receive go -> ok end,
 1444:                           Me ! port_control(Port,?MON_OP_MONITOR_ME_LATER,[]), 
 1445:                           Me ! process_info(self(),monitored_by), 
 1446:                           Me ! erlang:port_info(Port,monitors) ,
 1447:                           receive die -> ok end
 1448:                   end),
 1449:     Pid3 ! go,
 1450:     {ok,Id3} = receive
 1451:                    "ok:"++III ->
 1452:                        {ok,III}
 1453:                after 1000 ->
 1454:                          timeout
 1455:                end,
 1456:     ok = receive
 1457:              {monitored_by, [Me]} ->
 1458:                  ok
 1459:          after 1000 ->
 1460:                    timeout
 1461:          end,
 1462:     ok = receive
 1463:              {monitors, [{process,Me}]} ->
 1464:                  ok
 1465:          after 1000 ->
 1466:                    timeout
 1467:          end,
 1468:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,Id3),
 1469:     LLL1 = lists:sort([{process,Me},{process,Pid3}]),
 1470:     {monitors,LLL2} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1471:     LLL1 = lists:sort(LLL2),
 1472:     "ok" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1473:     {monitors,[{process,Pid3}]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1474:     Pid3 ! die,
 1475:     ok = receive
 1476:              {'DOWN', Ref3, process, Pid3, _} ->
 1477:                  ok
 1478:          after 1000 ->
 1479:                    timeout
 1480:          end,
 1481:     "not_found" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DO_DELAYED_MONITOR,Id2),
 1482:     {monitors,[]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1483:     "not_monitored" = port_control(Port,?MON_OP_DEMONITOR_ME,[]),
 1484:     {monitors,[]} = erlang:port_info(Port,monitors),
 1485:     {monitored_by, []} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1486: 
 1487:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
 1488:     ok.
 1489: 
 1490: 
 1491: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_INPUT, 1).
 1492: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_OUTPUT, 2).
 1493: -define(IOQ_EXIT_TIMEOUT, 3).
 1494: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_ASYNC, 4).
 1495: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_INPUT_ASYNC, 6).
 1496: -define(IOQ_EXIT_READY_OUTPUT_ASYNC, 7).
 1497: -define(IOQ_EXIT_TIMEOUT_ASYNC, 8).
 1498: 
 1499: ioq_exit_test(Config, TestNo) ->
 1500:     Drv = ioq_exit_drv,
 1501:     try
 1502:         begin
 1503:             case load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1504:                              Drv) of
 1505:                 ok -> ok;
 1506:                 {error, permanent} -> ok;
 1507:                 LoadError -> ct:fail({load_error, LoadError})
 1508:             end,
 1509:             case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1510:                 Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1511:                     try port_control(Port, TestNo, "") of
 1512:                         "ok" ->
 1513:                             ok;
 1514:                         "nyiftos" ->
 1515:                             throw({skipped,
 1516:                                    "Not yet implemented for "
 1517:                                    "this OS"});
 1518:                         [$s,$k,$i,$p,$:,$ | Comment] ->
 1519:                             throw({skipped, Comment});
 1520:                         [$e,$r,$r,$o,$r,$:,$ | Error] ->
 1521:                             ct:fail(Error)
 1522:                     after
 1523:                         Port ! {self(), close},
 1524:                         receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1525:                         false = lists:member(Port, erlang:ports()),
 1526:                         ok
 1527:                     end;
 1528:                 Error ->
 1529:                     ct:fail({open_port_failed, Error})
 1530:             end
 1531:         end
 1532:     catch
 1533:         throw:Term -> Term
 1534:     after
 1535:         erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
 1536:     end.
 1537: 
 1538: ioq_exit_ready_input(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1539:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_INPUT).
 1540: 
 1541: ioq_exit_ready_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1542:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_OUTPUT).
 1543: 
 1544: ioq_exit_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1545:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_TIMEOUT).
 1546: 
 1547: ioq_exit_ready_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1548:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_ASYNC).
 1549: 
 1550: ioq_exit_ready_input_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1551:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_INPUT_ASYNC).
 1552: 
 1553: ioq_exit_ready_output_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1554:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_READY_OUTPUT_ASYNC).
 1555: 
 1556: ioq_exit_timeout_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1557:     ioq_exit_test(Config, ?IOQ_EXIT_TIMEOUT_ASYNC).
 1558: 
 1559: 
 1560: vsn_mismatch_test(Config, LoadResult) ->
 1561:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1562:     DrvName = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
 1563:     LoadResult = load_driver(Path, DrvName),
 1564:     case LoadResult of
 1565:         ok ->
 1566:             Port = open_port({spawn, DrvName}, []),
 1567:             true = is_port(Port),
 1568:             true = port_close(Port),
 1569:             ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(DrvName);
 1570:         _ ->
 1571:             ok
 1572:     end.
 1573: 
 1574: zero_extended_marker_garb_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1575:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1576: 
 1577: invalid_extended_marker_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1578:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1579: 
 1580: larger_major_vsn_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1581:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1582: 
 1583: larger_minor_vsn_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1584:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1585: 
 1586: smaller_major_vsn_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1587:     vsn_mismatch_test(Config, {error, driver_incorrect_version}).
 1588: 
 1589: smaller_minor_vsn_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1590:     DrvVsnStr = erlang:system_info(driver_version),
 1591:     case drv_vsn_str2tup(DrvVsnStr) of
 1592:         {_, 0} ->
 1593:             {skipped,
 1594:              "Cannot perform test when minor driver version is 0. "
 1595:              "Current driver version is " ++ DrvVsnStr ++ "."};
 1596:         _ ->
 1597:             vsn_mismatch_test(Config, ok)
 1598:     end.
 1599: 
 1600: -define(PEEK_NONXQ_TEST, 0).
 1601: -define(PEEK_NONXQ_WAIT, 1).
 1602: 
 1603: peek_non_existing_queue(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1604:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1605:     Drv = peek_non_existing_queue_drv,
 1606:     try
 1607:         begin
 1608:             case load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1609:                              Drv) of
 1610:                 ok -> ok;
 1611:                 {error, permanent} -> ok;
 1612:                 LoadError -> ct:fail({load_error, LoadError})
 1613:             end,
 1614:             case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1615:                 Port1 when is_port(Port1) ->
 1616:                     try port_control(Port1, ?PEEK_NONXQ_TEST, "") of
 1617:                         "ok" ->
 1618:                             ok;
 1619:                         [$s,$k,$i,$p,$p,$e,$d,$:,$ | SkipReason] ->
 1620:                             throw({skipped, SkipReason});
 1621:                         [$e,$r,$r,$o,$r,$:,$ | Error1] ->
 1622:                             ct:fail(Error1)
 1623:                     after
 1624:                         exit(Port1, kill),
 1625:                         receive {'EXIT', Port1, _} -> ok end
 1626:                     end;
 1627:                 Error1 ->
 1628:                     ct:fail({open_port1_failed, Error1})
 1629:             end,
 1630:             case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1631:                 Port2 when is_port(Port2) ->
 1632:                     try port_control(Port2, ?PEEK_NONXQ_WAIT, "") of
 1633:                         "ok" ->
 1634:                             ok;
 1635:                         [$e,$r,$r,$o,$r,$:,$ | Error2] ->
 1636:                             ct:fail(Error2)
 1637:                     after
 1638:                         receive {Port2, test_successful} -> ok end,
 1639:                         Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1640:                         receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end
 1641:                     end;
 1642:                 Error2 ->
 1643:                     ct:fail({open_port2_failed, Error2})
 1644:             end
 1645:         end
 1646:     catch
 1647:         throw:Term -> Term
 1648:     after
 1649:         process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1650:         erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
 1651:     end.    
 1652: 
 1653: otp_6879(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1654:     Drv = 'otp_6879_drv',
 1655:     Parent = self(),
 1656:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), Drv),
 1657:     Procs = lists:map(
 1658:               fun (No) ->
 1659:                       spawn_link(
 1660:                         fun () ->
 1661:                                 case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1662:                                     Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1663:                                         Res = otp_6879_call(Port, No, 10000),
 1664:                                         erlang:port_close(Port),
 1665:                                         Parent ! {self(), Res};
 1666:                                     _ ->
 1667:                                         Parent ! {self(),
 1668:                                                   open_port_failed}
 1669:                                 end
 1670:                         end)
 1671:               end,
 1672:               lists:seq(1,10)),
 1673:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1674:                           receive
 1675:                               {P, ok} ->
 1676:                                   ok;
 1677:                               {P, Error} ->
 1678:                                   ct:fail({P, Error})
 1679:                           end
 1680:                   end,
 1681:                   Procs),
 1682:     %% Also try it when input exceeds default buffer (256 bytes)
 1683:     Data = lists:seq(1, 1000),
 1684:     case open_port({spawn, Drv}, []) of
 1685:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1686:             ok = otp_6879_call(Port, Data, 10),
 1687:             erlang:port_close(Port);
 1688:         _ ->
 1689:             ct:fail(open_port_failed)
 1690:     end,
 1691:     erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv),
 1692:     ok.
 1693: 
 1694: otp_6879_call(_Port, _Data, 0) ->
 1695:     ok;
 1696: otp_6879_call(Port, Data, N) ->
 1697:     case catch erlang:port_call(Port, 0, Data) of
 1698:         Data -> otp_6879_call(Port, Data, N-1);
 1699:         BadData -> {mismatch, Data, BadData}
 1700:     end.
 1701: 
 1702: caller(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1703:     run_caller_test(Config, false),
 1704:     run_caller_test(Config, true).
 1705: 
 1706: run_caller_test(Config, Outputv) ->
 1707:     Drv = 'caller_drv',
 1708:     Cmd = case Outputv of
 1709:               true ->
 1710:                   os:putenv("CALLER_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV",
 1711:                             "true"),
 1712:                   outputv;
 1713:               false ->
 1714:                   os:putenv("CALLER_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV",
 1715:                             "false"),
 1716:                   output
 1717:           end,
 1718:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), Drv),
 1719:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
 1720:     true = is_port(Port),
 1721:     chk_caller(Port, start, self()),
 1722:     chk_caller(Port,
 1723:                Cmd,
 1724:                spawn_link(
 1725:                  fun () ->
 1726:                          port_command(Port, "")
 1727:                  end)),
 1728:     Port ! {self(), {command, ""}},
 1729:     chk_caller(Port, Cmd, self()),
 1730:     chk_caller(Port,
 1731:                control,
 1732:                spawn_link(
 1733:                  fun () ->
 1734:                          port_control(Port, 0, "")
 1735:                  end)),
 1736:     chk_caller(Port,
 1737:                call,
 1738:                spawn_link(
 1739:                  fun () ->
 1740:                          erlang:port_call(Port, 0, "")
 1741:                  end)),
 1742:     true = port_close(Port),
 1743:     erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv),
 1744:     ok.
 1745: 
 1746: chk_caller(Port, Callback, ExpectedCaller) ->
 1747:     receive
 1748:         {caller, Port, Callback, Caller} ->
 1749:             ExpectedCaller = Caller
 1750:     end.
 1751: 
 1752: %% Check that many simultaneously signalled events work (win32)
 1753: many_events(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1754:     Name = 'many_events_drv',
 1755:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
 1756:     Number = "1000",
 1757:     Port ! {self(), {command, Number}},
 1758:     receive 
 1759:         {Port, {data,Number}} ->
 1760:             receive %% Just to make sure the emulator does not crash 
 1761:                 %% after this case is run (if faulty)
 1762:             after 2000 ->
 1763:                       ok
 1764:             end
 1765:     after 1000 ->
 1766:               exit(the_driver_does_not_respond)
 1767:     end,
 1768:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
 1769:     ok.
 1770: 
 1771: 
 1772: missing_callbacks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1773:     Name = 'missing_callback_drv',
 1774:     Port = start_driver(Config, Name, false),
 1775: 
 1776:     Port ! {self(), {command, "tjenix"}},
 1777:     true = erlang:port_command(Port, "halloj"),
 1778:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(Port, 4711, "mors")),
 1779:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_call(Port, 17, "hej")),
 1780: 
 1781:     %% Give the (non-existing) ready_output(), ready_input(), event(),
 1782:     %% and timeout() some time to be called.
 1783:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1784: 
 1785:     stop_driver(Port, Name),
 1786:     ok.
 1787: 
 1788: %% Test concurrent calls to driver_select.
 1789: smp_select(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
 1790:     case os:type() of
 1791:         {win32,_} -> {skipped, "Test not implemented for this OS"};
 1792:         _ -> rpc(Config, fun() -> smp_select0(Config) end)
 1793:     end.
 1794: 
 1795: smp_select0(Config) ->
 1796:     DrvName = 'chkio_drv',
 1797:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1798:     erl_ddll:start(),
 1799:     ok = load_driver(Path, DrvName),    
 1800:     Master = self(),
 1801:     ProcFun = fun()-> io:format("Worker ~p starting\n",[self()]),	
 1802:                       Port = open_port({spawn, DrvName}, []),
 1803:                       smp_select_loop(Port, 100000),
 1804:                       smp_select_done(Port),
 1805:                       true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 1806:                       Master ! {ok,self()},
 1807:                       io:format("Worker ~p finished\n",[self()])
 1808:               end,
 1809:     Pids = lists:map(fun(_) -> spawn_link(ProcFun) end,
 1810:                      lists:seq(1,4)),
 1811:     TimeoutMsg = make_ref(),
 1812:     {ok,TRef} = timer:send_after(5*1000, TimeoutMsg), % Limit test duration on slow machines
 1813:     smp_select_wait(Pids, TimeoutMsg),
 1814:     timer:cancel(TRef),
 1815:     ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(DrvName),
 1816:     ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
 1817:     ok.
 1818: 
 1819: smp_select_loop(_, 0) ->
 1820:     ok;
 1821: smp_select_loop(Port, N) ->
 1822:     case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_SMP_SELECT, []) of
 1823:         "yield" -> erlang:yield();
 1824:         "ok" -> ok
 1825:     end,
 1826:     receive
 1827:         stop -> 
 1828:             io:format("Worker ~p stopped with ~p laps left\n",[self(), N]), 
 1829:             ok
 1830:     after 0 ->
 1831:               smp_select_loop(Port, N-1)
 1832:     end.
 1833: 
 1834: smp_select_done(Port) ->
 1835:     case erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_SMP_SELECT, "done") of
 1836:         "wait" ->
 1837:             receive
 1838:                 {Port, done} ->
 1839:                     ok
 1840:             after 10*1000 ->
 1841:                     %% Seems we have a lost ready_input event.
 1842:                     %% Go ahead anyway, port will crash VM when closed.
 1843:                     ok
 1844:             end;
 1845: 
 1846:         "ok" -> ok
 1847:     end.
 1848: 
 1849: smp_select_wait([], _) ->
 1850:     ok;
 1851: smp_select_wait(Pids, TimeoutMsg) ->
 1852:     receive
 1853:         {ok,Pid} when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1854:             smp_select_wait(lists:delete(Pid,Pids), TimeoutMsg);
 1855:         TimeoutMsg ->
 1856:             lists:foreach(fun(Pid)-> Pid ! stop end,
 1857:                           Pids),
 1858:             smp_select_wait(Pids, TimeoutMsg)
 1859:     end.
 1860: 
 1861: 
 1862: %% Test driver_select() with new ERL_DRV_USE flag.
 1863: driver_select_use(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
 1864:     case os:type() of
 1865:         {win32,_} -> {skipped, "Test not implemented for this OS"};
 1866:         _ -> rpc(Config, fun() -> driver_select_use0(Config) end)
 1867:     end.
 1868: 
 1869: driver_select_use0(Config) ->
 1870:     DrvName = 'chkio_drv',
 1871:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1872:     erl_ddll:start(),
 1873:     ok = load_driver(Path, DrvName),    
 1874:     Port = open_port({spawn, DrvName}, []),
 1875:     "ok" = erlang:port_control(Port, ?CHKIO_DRV_USE, []),
 1876:     {Port,{data,"TheEnd"}} = receive Msg -> Msg
 1877:                              after 10000 -> timeout end,
 1878:     true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 1879:     ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(DrvName),
 1880:     ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
 1881:     ok.
 1882: 
 1883: lots_of_used_fds_on_boot(Config) ->
 1884:     case os:type() of
 1885:         {unix, _} -> lots_of_used_fds_on_boot_test(Config);
 1886:         _ -> {skipped, "Unix only test"}
 1887:     end.
 1888: 
 1889: lots_of_used_fds_on_boot_test(Config) ->
 1890:     %% Start a node in a wrapper which have lots of fds
 1891:     %% open. This used to hang the whole VM at boot in
 1892:     %% an eternal loop trying to figure out how to size
 1893:     %% arrays in erts_poll() implementation.
 1894:     Prog = case catch init:get_argument(progname) of
 1895: 	       {ok,[[P]]} -> P;
 1896: 	       _ -> exit(no_progname_argument_found)
 1897: 	   end,
 1898:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1899:     Wrapper = filename:join(DataDir, "lots_of_fds_used_wrapper"),
 1900:     try
 1901:         {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io, exec => {Wrapper, [Prog]}}),
 1902:         peer:stop(Peer)
 1903:     catch
 1904:         exit:{boot_failed, {exit_status, 17}} ->
 1905:             {skip, "Cannot open enough fds to test this"}
 1906:     end.
 1907: 
 1908: thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1909:     case {erlang:system_info(threads),
 1910:           erlang:system_info({allocator,mseg_alloc}),
 1911:           driver_alloc_sbct()} of
 1912:         {_, false, _} ->
 1913:             {skipped, "No mseg_alloc"};
 1914:         {false, _, _} ->
 1915:             {skipped, "No threads"};
 1916:         {_, _, false} ->
 1917:             {skipped, "driver_alloc() not using the alloc_util framework"};
 1918:         {_, _, SBCT} when is_integer(SBCT), SBCT > 10*1024*1024 ->
 1919:             {skipped, "driver_alloc() using too large single block threshold"};
 1920:         {_, _, 0} ->
 1921:             {skipped, "driver_alloc() using too low single block threshold"};
 1922:         {true, _MsegAllocInfo, SBCT} ->
 1923:             DrvName = 'thr_alloc_drv',
 1924:             Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1925:             erl_ddll:start(),
 1926:             ok = load_driver(Path, DrvName),   
 1927:             Port = open_port({spawn, DrvName}, []),
 1928:             CCI = 1000,
 1929:             io:format("CCI = ~p~n", [CCI]),
 1930:             CCC = mseg_alloc_ccc(),
 1931:             io:format("CCC = ~p~n", [CCC]),
 1932:             thread_mseg_alloc_cache_clean_test(Port,
 1933:                                                10,
 1934:                                                CCI,
 1935:                                                SBCT+100),
 1936:             true = erlang:port_close(Port),
 1937:             ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(DrvName),
 1938:             ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
 1939:             ok
 1940:     end.
 1941: 
 1942: mseg_alloc_ccc() ->
 1943:     mseg_alloc_ccc(mseg_inst_info(0)).
 1944: 
 1945: mseg_alloc_ccc(MsegAllocInfo) ->
 1946:     {value,{memkind, MKL}} = lists:keysearch(memkind,1,MsegAllocInfo),
 1947:     {value,{calls, CL}} = lists:keysearch(calls, 1, MKL),
 1948:     {value,{mseg_check_cache, GigaCCC, CCC}}
 1949:     = lists:keysearch(mseg_check_cache, 1, CL),
 1950:     GigaCCC*1000000000 + CCC.
 1951: 
 1952: mseg_alloc_cached_segments() ->
 1953:     mseg_alloc_cached_segments(mseg_inst_info(0)).
 1954: 
 1955: mseg_alloc_cached_segments(MsegAllocInfo) ->
 1956:     MemName = "all memory",
 1957:     [{memkind,DrvMem}]
 1958:     = lists:filter(fun(E) -> case E of
 1959:                                  {memkind, [{name, MemName} | _]} -> true;
 1960:                                  _ -> false
 1961:                              end end, MsegAllocInfo),
 1962:     {value,{status, SL}}
 1963:     = lists:keysearch(status, 1, DrvMem),
 1964:     {value,{cached_segments, CS}}
 1965:     = lists:keysearch(cached_segments, 1, SL),
 1966:     CS.
 1967: 
 1968: mseg_inst_info(I) ->
 1969:     {value, {instance, I, Value}}
 1970:     = lists:keysearch(I,
 1971:                       2,
 1972:                       erlang:system_info({allocator,mseg_alloc})),
 1973:     Value.
 1974: 
 1975: driver_alloc_sbct() ->
 1976:     {_, _, _, As} = erlang:system_info(allocator),
 1977:     case lists:keysearch(driver_alloc, 1, As) of
 1978:         {value,{driver_alloc,DAOPTs}} ->
 1979:             case lists:keysearch(sbct, 1, DAOPTs) of
 1980:                 {value,{sbct,SBCT}} ->
 1981:                     SBCT;
 1982:                 _ ->
 1983:                     false
 1984:             end;
 1985:         _ ->
 1986:             false
 1987:     end.
 1988:
